lines.content: This is a project created from the Duke project template (for a greenfield Java project).
* Parser class for parsing user inputs in the Zero bot.
* Parses input string in the form of "[cmd] [index/name] [args...]".

*

[args...] are in the form of "/[arg name] [value]". For example:
* Parses the input string in 1-based indexing and returns an int in 0-based indexing.
* @param index String to parse with 1-based indexing.
* @throws NumberFormatException If the string does not contain a parsable integer.
static int parseIndex(String index) throws NumberFormatException {
* Checks if the string is null, empty or filled with blank spaces
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the string is null, empty or filled with blank spaces.
static void checkNullOrEmpty(String s) throws IllegalArgumentException {
* Parses the input string and returns a {@code LocalDateTime} object.
* @param s String to parse, in the form specified in {@link controller.Parser#dtfInput}
* @throws NullPointerException If the string is null.
* @throws DateTimeParseException If the string cannot be parsed.
static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String s) throws NullPointerException, DateTimeParseException {
* Main control class for running the Zero bot.

*

The bot can be run by creating a new instance and calling the {@link controller.Zero#run()} method.

*

After the bot is done running, call {@link controller.Zero#close()} to properly terminate.
private static final Reader USER_INPUT = new InputStreamReader(System.in);
private static final Writer USER_OUTPUT = new OutputStreamWriter(System.out);
private static final String DATE_TIME_INPUT_FORMAT = "dd/mm/yy HHMM"; // For display to users
DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("EEE, d MMM uuuu, hh:mm a");

Contains the main Zero bot logic and decision making.

error = "/to"; // [from] date successfully parsed, change possible error to [to]

* Commands that are available for use in Zero.
* The {@code Deadline} class represents deadline tasks.
* Contructor to create a new {@code Deadline} object, with {@code done} set to {@code false} by default.
* @param name Name of the deadline task.
* @param deadline {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the deadline.
private Deadline(String name, boolean done, LocalDateTime deadline) {
* @return {@code Deadline} object with {@code done} set as {@code true}.
* @return {@code Deadline} object with {@code done} set as {@code false}.
* The {@code Event} class represents event tasks.
* Contructor to create a new {@code Event} object, with {@code done} set to {@code false} by default.
* @param name Name of the event task.
* @param startDate {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the start of the event.
* @param endDate {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the end of the event.
Event(String name, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {
private Event(String name, boolean done, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {
* @return {@code Event} object with {@code done} set as {@code true}.
return new Event(name, true, startDate, endDate);
* @return {@code Event} object with {@code done} set as {@code false}.
return new Event(name, false, startDate, endDate);
* Main storage class for running the Zero bot.

*

Handles saves and writes to the save file, as well as keeping track of all tasks in a {@code TaskList}.
* Initializes the {@code Storage} instance with the {@code TaskList} in the save file.

*

Creates a new empty {@code TaskList} if the save file is not found, or an error occurs while loading the save file.
* @param filePath The {@code String} path of the save file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
// Attempt to load TaskList from save file
saveTaskList(); // Rewrite task data as readObject deletes save data

saveFile.createNewFile(); // Throws Exception if unable to create, terminate the program

* The {@code Task} interface represents the basic functionality of a task.

*

Each {@code Task} is able to be set as complete or incomplete.
* @return {@code Task} object with mark set as complete.
* @return {@code Task} object with mark set as incomplete.
* The {@code TaskList} class represents a list of tasks.

*

This class inherits {@code Serializable} for storage.
* Constructor to initialise a new empty {@code TaskList}.

* @param name Name of the "To Do" task.
* @return {@code ToDo} task added to this {@code TaskList}.
* Overloaded Method to add a {@code Deadline} task.
* @param name Name of the deadline task.
* @param deadline {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the deadline.
* @return {@code Deadline} task added to this {@code TaskList}.
public Task addTask(String name, LocalDateTime deadline) {

public Task addTask(String name, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
